recipe.ingredients: - large mushrooms: 12 - olive oil: 1 tablespoon - onion (finely chopped): 1/2 cup - garlic (minced): 2 cloves - spinach (chopped): 1 cup - breadcrumbs: 1/2 cup - nutritional yeast: 2 tablespoons - salt: 1/4 teaspoon - black pepper: 1/4 teaspoon - fresh parsley (chopped, for garnish): 2 tablespoons
recipe.directions: 1. Prepare Mushrooms: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C). Remove the stems from the mushrooms, chop the stems finely, and set aside. Place the mushroom caps on a baking tray. 2. Sauté Filling: Heat olive oil in a frying pan over medium heat. Add chopped onion and garlic, and sauté until onions are translucent. Add chopped mushroom stems and cook until they are soft. Stir in spinach and cook until wilted. 3. Mix Filling: Remove from heat. In a bowl, mix sautéed vegetables with breadcrumbs, nutritional yeast, salt, and pepper until well combined. 4. Stuff Mushrooms: Spoon the filling into each mushroom cap, pressing down to pack it in. 5. Bake: Place the stuffed mushrooms in the preheated oven and bake for 20 minutes or until the mushrooms are tender and the tops are golden brown. 6. Garnish and Serve: Garnish with fresh parsley before serving.
recipe.nutrition: Total Carbohydrate: 22g, Dietary Fiber: 4g, Sodium: 295mg, Saturated Fat: 1g, Total Fat: 8g, Protein: 8g, Cholesterol: 0mg, Added Sugars: 0g, Total Sugars: 3g
recipe.total_calories_estimation: - Total Calories for entire recipe : Approximately 398 calories for the entire recipe. - Calories for each ingredient: Large Mushrooms: 88 calories for 12 mushrooms Olive Oil: 119 calories for 1 tablespoon Onion: 32 calories for 1/2 cup chopped Garlic: 9 calories for 2 cloves Spinach: 7 calories for 1 cup chopped Breadcrumbs: 110 calories for 1/2 cup Nutritional Yeast: 30 calories for 2 tablespoons Salt, Black Pepper, Parsley: Negligible - Serving People: 4
